project.teaser: Research assessment plays a crucial role in research systems, but current practices prioritize quantitative metrics and publications without recognising the diversity of research outputs or open science practices. To address these issues, international initiatives have...
project.objective: Research assessment plays a crucial role in research systems, but current practices prioritize quantitative metrics and publications without recognising the diversity of research outputs or open science practices. To address these issues, international initiatives have emerged, and the EU European Research Area Policy Agenda for 2022-2024 includes a specific action (Action 3) on Reform the Assessment System for research, researchers and institutions. In 2022, the EC, Science Europe, and the European University Association facilitated the development of the Agreement on Reforming Research Assessment, which emphasises qualitative evaluation based on peer review and responsible use of quantitative indicators, and discourages the use of inappropriate metrics and rankings. 423 organisations signatories to agreement decided to constitute the Coalition for Advancing Research Assessment (CoARA) to make progress on ten commitments within a five-year timeframe. As an enabler deeply rooted in the CoARA structure, the CoARA Boost project will strengthen the ramp-up of CoARA, enhancing the operational capacity and providing means to investigate and implement new models for research assessment. By amplifying its spectrum of actions and providing the additional capacity to implement a Cascade funding programme, CoARA Boost will allow to develop a critical mass for reforming research assessment, generate gravitas for new members and facilitate the leveraging of additional sources of funding. The overarching objective of the CoARA Boost Project is to contribute to enabling systemic reform of research assessment following the principles and commitments of the Agreement on Reforming Research Assessment. CoARA Boost will i) strengthen CoARA’s operational capacity, ii) catalyse knowledge development, policy evolution and institutional change in research assessment, iii) facilitate collection and exchange of information and iv) widen the Coalition’s membership in Europe and beyond.
project.title: Strengthening CoARA and Enabling Systemic Reform of Research Assessment - A Booster
project.keywords: Coalition For Advancing Research Assessment, Qualitative Evaluation, Responsible Research Assessment, Institutional Change, Modernisation of Research Systems, Open Science, Internationalisation

result.title: 2nd cascade funding competitive call text and guidelines for applicants
result.description: This deliverable will provide the content of the second cascade funding call as well as the guide for applicants.

result.title: Plan for dissemination and exploitation including communication activities
result.description: This deliverable will detail CoARA Boost's communication and dissemination framework as well as the concrete approach to raise awareness on CoARA, CoARA Boost and their outcomes.

result.title: Revised Operational Framework report
result.description: This deliverable will provide a revision of the WG Operational Framework at the end of the first WG cycle.

result.title: List of projects supported through the 1st cascade funding competitive call
result.description: This deliverable will present the list of projects that will be selected and supported by the CoARA Boost cascade funding programme as a result of the first call.

result.title: 1st cascade funding competitive call text and guidelines for applicants
result.description: This deliverable will provide the content of the first cascade funding call as well as the guide for applicants.

result.title: Cascade funding template sub-grant agreement
result.description: This deliverable will provide the detailed conditions of cascade funding sub-grants, these will have to be signed with successful projects.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: This deliverable will be the first version of CoARA Boost DMP. It will define how data used and generated will be managed throughout the project and the consortium. The DMP will serve as a living document and will be internally udated at M18 and M32.

result.title: WGs Operational Framework report
result.description: This deliverable will will detail the WGs operational support perimeter as well as set out the processes and coordination mechanisms for CoARA WGs.

result.title: Cascade Funding Data Repository
result.description: This data repository will allow to store and make accessible the data generated by projects supported by the CoARA Boost Cascade Funding programme.

result.title: The role of scientometrics in the pursuit of responsible research assessment

result.teaser: Research assessment is critical to research systems, yet current practices overly rely on metrics and publications, overlooking diverse outputs and open science. International efforts, including the EU’s ERA Policy Agenda (Action 3), seek reform. The 2022 Agreement on...

category.title: Report Summary

result.title: Book of IT infrastructure specifications V2
result.description: This deliverable will provide the specifications of the full IT infrastructure required by CoARA Boost operations. V1 of the prresent deliverable will be prepared as an internal report at M2.

result.title: First progress report of WGs, inc. Co-Chairs Forum
result.description: This report will present the activities of the CoARA WGs in the first half of the project. It will also report on the outcome of the WGs Co-Chairs exchanges.

result.title: A Vision & Framework for Research Cultures: Improving the Condition for Researchers, Research Ideas, and the Research Endeavour

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
